result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Victor Terrell Lewis

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Victor Terrell Lewis appeared by video.  Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court for Victor Terrell Lewis.  Prosecuting attorney Brad Alan Vorpahl in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt. 

DTC - PHASE ORIENTATION

Review Hearing proceeded. Court held colloquy with the defendant. The Court commended the defendant for compliance with the program and awarded the defendant 1 point. Based upon the defendant's compliance with the Drug Treatment Court Contract, case adjourned for review hearing, Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Victor Terrell Lewis appeared by video.  Attorney Zoe Plovanich in court for Victor Terrell Lewis.  Prosecuting attorney David T. Malone in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
DTC - PHASE ORIENTATION

Review Hearing proceeded.  Court held colloquy with the defendant.  The Court commended the defendant for compliance with the program and awarded the defendant 2 points.  Based upon the defendant's compliance with the Drug Treatment Court Contract, case adjourned for review hearing, Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel
Received and Filed. Completion of representation

Defendant Victor Terrell Lewis appeared by video.  Attorney Amanda M. Parent in court for Victor Terrell Lewis.  Prosecuting attorney Brad Alan Vorpahl in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
DTC - PHASE 

Review Hearing proceeded.  Court held colloquy with the defendant.  The Court commended the defendant for compliance with the program and awarded the defendant 0 points.  Based upon the defendant's compliance with the Drug Treatment Court Contract, case adjourned for review hearing, Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Victor Terrell Lewis appeared by video.  Attorney Amanda M. Parent in court for Victor Terrell Lewis.  Prosecuting attorney David T. Malone in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
DTC -  ORIENTATION PHASE 

Review Hearing proceeded.  Court held colloquy with the defendant.  The Court commended the defendant for compliance with the program and awarded the defendant 0 points.  Based upon the defendant's compliance with the Drug Treatment Court Contract, case adjourned for review hearing, Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Cash bail remains as set until placement is found.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TURN OVER TO JUSTICEPOINT FOR PLACEMENT. UPON PLACEMENT BAIL TO CONVERT TO $250.00 PR BOND.
  As a condition of bail, court order the defendant may not possess dangerous weapons or firearms or apply for a conceal carry permit.

Defendant Victor Terrell Lewis in court, in custody.  Attorney Amanda M. Parent in court for Victor Terrell Lewis.  Prosecuting attorney Brad Alan Vorpahl in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt. 

The parties have agreed to a Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court deferred prosecution agreement and participation contract.

As to Count 1: The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, entered a plea of GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgment of Conviction.  The court approved the Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement and Participant Contract and ordered the proceedings suspended for an initial period of 12 months to 18 months. 

As to Count 2: Pursuant to negotiations and on State's motion, Court orders Count 2 dismissed but read-in.

Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing, Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Victor Terrell Lewis not in court, in custody.  Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont appeared by video for Victor Terrell Lewis.  Attorney Stephanie Krueger in court for State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for status conference.  Defense informed the Court of possible transfer to Drug Treatment Court.  Court set a status date in Branch 40.
Status conference scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court, defendant Victor Terrell Lewis not in court, in custody.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense informed the Court of a referral to Drug Treatment Court and requests a status date.  Court set date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Status conference scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Victor Terrell Lewis in court with Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont; both appear by video.  Defendant Victor Terrell Lewis in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 40, Judge Shelton. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Attorney Mary Guimont

Court ordered no contact with 1570 N. Edison St., City and County of Milwaukee, Wisconsin
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.

Defendant Victor Terrell Lewis in court with attorney Colin Patrick McGinn.  Defendant Victor Terrell Lewis in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
